answers.description: An array of available answers to display to the student.

id.description: The unique identifier for the answer.  Do not supply if this answer is part of a new question

answer_weight.description: An integer to determine correctness of the answer. Incorrect answers should be 0, correct answers should be 100.

answer_comments.description: Specific contextual comments for a particular answer.
answer_comments.example: Remember to check your spelling prior to submitting this answer.

text_after_answers.description: Used in missing word questions.  The text to follow the missing word

answer_match_left.description: Used in matching questions.  The static value of the answer that will be displayed on the left for students to match for.

answer_match_right.description: Used in matching questions. The correct match for the value given in answer_match_left.  Will be displayed in a dropdown with the other answer_match_right values..

matching_answer_incorrect_matches.description:
Used in matching questions. A list of distractors, delimited by new lines (
) that will be seeded with all the answer_match_right values.

numerical_answer_type.description: Used in numerical questions.  Values can be 'exact_answer', 'range_answer', or 'precision_answer'.

exact.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'exact_answer'.  The value the answer should equal.

margin.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'exact_answer'. The margin of error allowed for the student's answer.

approximate.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'precision_answer'.  The value the answer should equal.

precision.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'precision_answer'. The numerical precision that will be used when comparing the student's answer.

start.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'range_answer'. The start of the allowed range (inclusive).

end.description: Used in numerical questions of type 'range_answer'. The end of the allowed range (inclusive).

blank_id.description: Used in fill in multiple blank and multiple dropdowns questions.

id.description: The ID of the planner note

title.description: The title for a planner note

description.description: The description of the planner note
description.example: I need to bring books tomorrow for my course on biology

user_id.description: The id of the associated user creating the planner note

workflow_state.description: The current published state of the planner note

course_id.description: The course that the note is in relation too, if applicable

todo_date.description: The datetime of when the planner note should show up on their planner

linked_object_type.description: the type of the linked learning object

linked_object_id.description: the id of the linked learning object

linked_object_html_url.description: the Canvas web URL of the linked learning object

linked_object_url.description: the API URL of the linked learning object

PlannerOverride.description: User-controlled setting for whether an item should be displayed on the planner or not

id.description: The ID of the planner override

plannable_type.description: The type of the associated object for the planner override

plannable_id.description: The id of the associated object for the planner override

user_id.description: The id of the associated user for the planner override

assignment_id.description: The id of the plannable's associated assignment, if it has one

workflow_state.description: The current published state of the item, synced with the associated object

marked_complete.description: Controls whether or not the associated plannable item is marked complete on the planner

dismissed.description: Controls whether or not the associated plannable item shows up in the opportunities list

created_at.description: The datetime of when the planner override was created

updated_at.description: The datetime of when the planner override was updated

deleted_at.description: The datetime of when the planner override was deleted, if applicable

id.description: The unique identifier for the account role/user assignment.

role.description: The account role assigned. This can be 'AccountAdmin' or a user-defined role created by the Roles API.

user.description: The user the role is assigned to. See the Users API for details.

workflow_state.description: The status of the account role/user assignment.

id.description: The ID of the quiz statistics report.

quiz_id.description:
The ID of the Quiz the statistics report is for. 
NOTE: AVAILABLE ONLY IN NON-JSON-API REQUESTS.

multiple_attempts_exist.description: Whether there are any students that have made mutliple submissions for this quiz.

includes_all_versions.description: In the presence of multiple attempts, this field describes whether the statistics describe all the submission attempts and not only the latest ones.

generated_at.description: The time at which the statistics were generated, which is usually after the occurrence of a quiz event, like a student submitting it.

url.description: The API HTTP/HTTPS URL to this quiz statistics.

html_url.description: The HTTP/HTTPS URL to the page where the statistics can be seen visually.

question_statistics.description: Question-specific statistics for each question and its answers.

submission_statistics.description: Question-specific statistics for each question and its answers.

links.description:
JSON-API construct that contains links to media related to this quiz statistics object. 
NOTE: AVAILABLE ONLY IN JSON-API REQUESTS.

QuizStatisticsLinks.description: Links to media related to QuizStatistics.

quiz.description: HTTP/HTTPS API URL to the quiz this statistics describe.

QuizStatisticsQuestionStatistics.description: Statistics for submissions made to a specific quiz question.

responses.description: Number of students who have provided an answer to this question. Blank or empty responses are not counted.

answers.description: Statistics related to each individual pre-defined answer.

QuizStatisticsAnswerStatistics.description: Statistics for a specific pre-defined answer in a Multiple-Choice or True/False quiz question.

id.description: ID of the answer.

text.description: The text attached to the answer.

weight.description: An integer to determine correctness of the answer. Incorrect answers should be 0, correct answers should 100

responses.description: Number of students who have chosen this answer.

QuizStatisticsAnswerPointBiserial.description: A point-biserial construct for a single pre-defined answer in a Multiple-Choice or True/False question.

answer_id.description: ID of the answer the point biserial is for.

point_biserial.description: The point biserial value for this answer. Value ranges between -1 and 1.

correct.description: Convenience attribute that denotes whether this is the correct answer as opposed to being a distractor. This is mutually exclusive with the `distractor` value

distractor.description: Convenience attribute that denotes whether this is a distractor answer and not the correct one. This is mutually exclusive with the `correct` value

QuizStatisticsSubmissionStatistics.description: Generic statistics for all submissions for a quiz.

unique_count.description: The number of students who have taken the quiz.

score_average.description: The mean of the student submission scores.

score_stdev.description: Standard deviation of the submission scores.

scores.description: A percentile distribution of the student scores, each key is the percentile (ranges between 0 and 100%) while the value is the number of students who received that score.

correct_count_average.description: The mean of the number of questions answered correctly by each student.

incorrect_count_average.description: The mean of the number of questions answered incorrectly by each student.

duration_average.description: The average time spent by students while taking the quiz.

id.description: The ID of the CommMessage.

created_at.description: The date and time this message was created

sent_at.description: The date and time this message was sent

workflow_state.description: The workflow state of the message. Possible values: 'created' : The message has been created, but not yet processed. 'staged' : The message is queued for sending. 'sending' : The message is being sent currently. 'sent' : The message has been successfully sent. 'bounced' : An error occurred during the sending of the message.'dashboard' : The message has been sent to the dashboard. 'closed' :  The message has been sent and closed, typically for dashboard messages or messages sent to deleted users. 'cancelled' : The message was cancelled before it could be sent.

from.description: The address that was put in the 'from' field of the message

from_name.description: The display name for the from address

to.description: The address the message was sent to:

reply_to.description: The reply_to header of the message

body.description: The plain text body of the message
body.example: This is the body of the message

html_body.description: The HTML body of the message.
html_body.example: <html><body>This is the body of the message</body></html>

id.description: The unique identifier for the report.

file_url.description: The url to the report download.

attachment.description: The attachment api object of the report. Only available after the report has completed.

created_at.description: The date and time the report was created.

started_at.description: The date and time the report started processing.

ended_at.description: The date and time the report finished processing.

parameters.description: The report parameters

ReportParameters.description: The parameters returned will vary for each report.

assignment_id.description: The ID of the Assignment the extension belongs to.

user_id.description: The ID of the Student that needs the assignment extension.

extra_attempts.description: Number of times the student is allowed to re-submit the assignment

Appointment.description: Date and time for an appointment

id.description: The appointment identifier.
The ID of the appointment group

title.description: The title of the appointment group

start_at.description: The start of the first time slot in the appointment group

end_at.description: The end of the last time slot in the appointment group

description.description: The text description of the appointment group

location_name.description: The location name of the appointment group

location_address.description: The address of the appointment group's location

participant_count.description: The number of participant who have reserved slots (see include[] argument)

reserved_times.description: The start and end times of slots reserved by the current user as well as the id of the calendar event for the reservation (see include[] argument)

allow_observer_signup.description: Boolean indicating whether observer users should be able to sign-up for an appointment

context_codes.description: The context codes (i.e. courses) this appointment group belongs to. Only people in these courses will be eligible to sign up.

sub_context_codes.description: The sub-context codes (i.e. course sections and group categories) this appointment group is restricted to

workflow_state.description: Current state of the appointment group ('pending', 'active' or 'deleted'). 'pending' indicates that it has not been published yet and is invisible to participants.

requiring_action.description: Boolean indicating whether the current user needs to sign up for this appointment group (i.e. it's reservable and the min_appointments_per_participant limit has not been met by this user).

appointments_count.description: Number of time slots in this appointment group

appointments.description: Calendar Events representing the time slots (see include[] argument) Refer to the Calendar Events API for more information

new_appointments.description: Newly created time slots (same format as appointments above). Only returned in Create/Update responses where new time slots have been added

max_appointments_per_participant.description: Maximum number of time slots a user may register for, or null if no limit

min_appointments_per_participant.description: Minimum number of time slots a user must register for. If not set, users do not need to sign up for any time slots

participants_per_appointment.description: Maximum number of participants that may register for each time slot, or null if no limit

participant_visibility.description: 'private' means participants cannot see who has signed up for a particular time slot, 'protected' means that they can

participant_type.description: Indicates how participants sign up for the appointment group, either as individuals ('User') or in student groups ('Group'). Related to sub_context_codes (i.e. 'Group' signups always have a single group category)

url.description: URL for this appointment group (to update, delete, etc.)

html_url.description: URL for a user to view this appointment group

created_at.description: When the appointment group was created

updated_at.description: When the appointment group was last updated

user_id.description: Canvas user ID of the student

failed.description: List of accommodations that failed to process

user_id.description: Canvas user ID of the student

error.example: User is not in any in-progress quiz sessions for course 3

example.error: User is not in any in-progress quiz sessions for course 3

CourseAccommodationRequest.description: Request format for setting course-level accommodations

user_id.description: Canvas user ID of the student receiving accommodations

extra_time.description: Amount of extra time (in minutes) for quiz submission

apply_to_in_progress_quiz_sessions.description: Apply accommodations to ongoing quiz sessions

reduce_choices_enabled.description: Removes one incorrect answer from multiple-choice questions with 4+ choices

QuizAccommodationRequest.description: Request format for setting quiz-level accommodations

user_id.description: Canvas user ID of the student receiving accommodations

extra_time.description: Amount of extra time (in minutes) for quiz submission

extra_attempts.description: Number of additional attempts allowed beyond the quiz limit

reduce_choices_enabled.description: Removes one incorrect answer from multiple-choice questions with 4+ choices

token.description: The InstAccess token itself -- a signed, encrypted JWT

points.description: A non-negative number of points for the rating

mastery.description: Indicates the rating where mastery is first achieved

color.description: The hex color code of the rating

ratings.description: An array of proficiency ratings. See the ProficiencyRating specification above.

created_at.description: timestamp of the event

pseudonym_id.description: ID of the pseudonym (login) associated with the event

account_id.description: ID of the account associated with the event. will match the account_id in the associated pseudonym.

user_id.description: ID of the user associated with the event will match the user_id in the associated pseudonym.

Lti::Registration.description: A registration of an LTI tool in Canvas

id.description: the Canvas ID of the Lti::Registration object

name.description: Tool-provided registration name

icon_url.description: Tool-provided URL to the tool's icon

vendor.description: Tool-provided name of the tool vendor

account_id.description: The Canvas id of the account that owns this registration

internal_service.description: Flag indicating if registration is internally-owned

inherited.description: Flag indicating if registration is owned by this account, or inherited from Site Admin

lti_version.description: LTI version of the registration, either 1.1 or 1.3

dynamic_registration.description: Flag indicating if registration was created using LTI Dynamic Registration. Only present if lti_version is 1.3

workflow_state.description: The state of the registration

created_at.description: Timestamp of the registration's creation

updated_at.description: Timestamp of the registration's last update

created_by.description: The user that created this registration. Not always present. If a string, this registration was created by Instructure.

updated_by.description: The user that last updated this registration. Not always present. If a string, this registration was last updated by Instructure.

root_account_id.description: The Canvas id of the root account

account_binding.description: The binding for this registration and this account

configuration.description: The Canvas-style tool configuration for this registration

title.description: The display name of the tool

description.example: My Tool is built by me, for me.

custom_fields.description: A key-value listing of all custom fields the tool has requested

target_link_uri.description: The default launch URL for the tool. Overridable by placements.

oidc_initiation_url.description: 1.3 specific. URL used for initial login request

oidc_initiation_urls.description: 1.3 specific. Region-specific login URLs for data protection compliance

public_jwk.description: 1.3 specific. The tool's public JWK in JSON format. Discouraged in favor of a url hosting a JWK set.

public_jwk_url.description: 1.3 specific. The tool-hosted URL containing its public JWK keyset. Canvas may cache JWKs up to 5 minutes.

scopes.description: 1.3 specific. List of LTI scopes requested by the tool

oauth_compliant.description: 1.1 specific. If true, query parameters from the launch URL will not be copied to the POST body.

total.description: The total number of LTI registrations across all pages

id.description: The fully qualified URL for showing, updating, and deleting the Line Item

scoreMaximum.description: The maximum score of the Line Item

label.description: The label of the Line Item.

tag.description: Tag used to qualify a line Item beyond its ids

resourceId.description: A Tool Provider specified id for the Line Item. Multiple line items can share the same resourceId within a given context

resourceLinkId.description: The resource link id the Line Item is attached to

https://canvas.instructure.com/lti/submi.description: The extension that defines the submission_type of the line_item. Only returns if set through the line_item create endpoint.

UserDisplay.description: This mini-object is used for secondary user responses, when we just want to provide enough information to display a user.

id.description: The ID of the user.

short_name.description: A short name the user has selected, for use in conversations or other less formal places through the site.

avatar_image_url.description: If avatars are enabled, this field will be included and contain a url to retrieve the user's avatar.

html_url.description: URL to access user, either nested to a context or directly.

AnonymousUserDisplay.description: This mini-object is returned in place of UserDisplay when returning student data for anonymous assignments, and includes an anonymous ID to identify a user within the scope of a single assignment.

anonymous_id.description: A unique short ID identifying this user within the scope of a particular assignment.

avatar_image_url.description: A URL to retrieve a generic avatar.

display_name.description: The anonymized display name for the student.

User.description: A Canvas user, e.g. a student, teacher, administrator, observer, etc.

id.description: The ID of the user.

name.description: The name of the user.

sortable_name.description: The name of the user that is should be used for sorting groups of users, such as in the gradebook.

last_name.description: The last name of the user.

first_name.description: The first name of the user.

short_name.description: A short name the user has selected, for use in conversations or other less formal places through the site.

sis_user_id.description: The SIS ID associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to manage SIS information.

integration_id.description: The integration_id associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.

login_id.description: The unique login id for the user.  This is what the user uses to log in to Canvas.

avatar_url.description: If avatars are enabled, this field will be included and contain a url to retrieve the user's avatar.

avatar_state.description: Optional: If avatars are enabled and caller is admin, this field can be requested and will contain the current state of the user's avatar.

enrollments.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return a list of the users active enrollments. See the List enrollments API for more details about the format of these records.

email.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return the users primary email address.

locale.description: Optional: This field can be requested with certain API calls, and will return the users locale in RFC 5646 format.

last_login.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return a timestamp representing the last time the user logged in to canvas.

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

pronouns.description: Optional: This field is only returned if pronouns are enabled, and will return the pronouns of the user.

Profile.description: Profile details for a Canvas user.

id.description: The ID of the user.

name.description: Sample User

avatar_url.description: The avatar_url can change over time, so we recommend not caching it for more than a few hours

time_zone.description: Optional: This field is only returned in certain API calls, and will return the IANA time zone name of the user's preferred timezone.

k5_user.description: Optional: Whether or not the user is a K5 user. This field is nil if the user settings are not for the user making the request.

use_classic_font_in_k5.description: Optional: Whether or not the user should see the classic font on the dashboard. Only applies if k5_user is true. This field is nil if the user settings are not for the user making the request.

type.description: ['gravatar'|'attachment'|'no_pic'] The type of avatar record, for categorization purposes.

url.description: The url of the avatar

token.description: A unique representation of the avatar record which can be used to set the avatar with the user update endpoint. Note: this is an internal representation and is subject to change without notice. It should be consumed with this api endpoint and used in the user update endpoint, and should not be constructed by the client.

display_name.description: A textual description of the avatar record.

id.description: ['attachment' type only] the internal id of the attachment

content-type.description: ['attachment' type only] the content-type of the attachment.

filename.description: ['attachment' type only] the filename of the attachment

size.description: ['attachment' type only] the size of the attachment

PageView.description: The record of a user page view access in Canvas

id.description: A UUID representing the page view.  This is also the unique request id

app_name.description: If the request is from an API request, the app that generated the access token

url.description: The URL requested

context_type.description: The type of context for the request

asset_type.description: The type of asset in the context for the request, if any

controller.description: The rails controller that handled the request

action.description: The rails action that handled the request

contributed.description: This field is deprecated, and will always be false

interaction_seconds.description: An approximation of how long the user spent on the page, in seconds

created_at.description: When the request was made

user_request.description: A flag indicating whether the request was user-initiated, or automatic (such as an AJAX call)

render_time.description: How long the response took to render, in seconds

user_agent.description: The user-agent of the browser or program that made the request
user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_8_5) AppleWebKit/536.30.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/6.0.5 Safari/536.30.1

participated.description: True if the request counted as participating, such as submitting homework

http_method.description: The HTTP method such as GET or POST

remote_ip.description: The origin IP address of the request

links.description: The page view links to define the relationships

PageViewLinks.description: The links of a page view access in Canvas

user.description: The ID of the user for this page view

context.description: The ID of the context for the request (course id if context_type is Course, etc)

asset.description: The ID of the asset for the request, if any

real_user.description: The ID of the actual user who made this request, if the request was made by a user who was masquerading

account.description: The ID of the account context for this page view

name.description: the actual name of the course
name.example: S1048576 DPMS1200 Intro to Newtonian Mechanics

nickname.description: the calling user's nickname for the course

id.description: The id of the conference

conference_key.description: The 3rd party's ID for the conference

duration.description: The expected duration the conference is supposed to last

ended_at.description: The date that the conference ended at, null if it hasn't ended

started_at.description: The date the conference started at, null if it hasn't started

users.description: Array of user ids that are participants in the conference

invitees.description: Array of user ids that are invitees in the conference

attendees.description: Array of user ids that are attendees in the conference

has_advanced_settings.description: True if the conference type has advanced settings.

long_running.description: If true the conference is long running and has no expected end time

user_settings.description: A collection of settings specific to the conference type

recordings.description: A List of recordings for the conference

url.description: URL for the conference, may be null if the conference type doesn't set it

join_url.description: URL to join the conference, may be null if the conference type doesn't set it

context_type.description: The type of this conference's context, typically 'Course' or 'Group'.

context_id.description: The ID of this conference's context.

total.description: The total points earned in the course

possible.description: The total points possible for the course

dropped.description: The dropped grades for the course

id.description: The ID of the enrollment.

course_id.description: The unique id of the course.

sis_course_id.description: The SIS Course ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

course_integration_id.description: The Course Integration ID in which the enrollment is associated. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

course_section_id.description: The unique id of the user's section.

section_integration_id.description: The Section Integration ID in which the enrollment is associated. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_account_id.description: The SIS Account ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_section_id.description: The SIS Section ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_user_id.description: The SIS User ID in which the enrollment is associated. Only displayed if present. This field is only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

enrollment_state.description: The state of the user's enrollment in the course.

limit_privileges_to_course_section.description: User can only access his or her own course section.

sis_import_id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import. This field is only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

root_account_id.description: The unique id of the user's account.

user_id.description: The unique id of the user.

associated_user_id.description: The unique id of the associated user. Will be null unless type is ObserverEnrollment.

role.description: The enrollment role, for course-level permissions. This field will match `type` if the enrollment role has not been customized.

role_id.description: The id of the enrollment role.

created_at.description: The created time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

updated_at.description: The updated time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

start_at.description: The start time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

end_at.description: The end time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

last_activity_at.description: The last activity time of the user for the enrollment, in ISO8601 format.

last_attended_at.description: The last attended date of the user for the enrollment in a course, in ISO8601 format.

total_activity_time.description: The total activity time of the user for the enrollment, in seconds.

html_url.description: The URL to the Canvas web UI page for this course enrollment.

grades.description: The URL to the Canvas web UI page containing the grades associated with this enrollment.

override_grade.description: The user's override grade for the course.

override_score.description: The user's override score for the course.

unposted_current_grade.description: The user's current grade in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins.

unposted_final_grade.description: The user's final grade for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_current_score.description: The user's current score in the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

unposted_final_score.description: The user's final score for the class including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permissions to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins..

has_grading_periods.description: optional: Indicates whether the course the enrollment belongs to has grading periods set up. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

totals_for_all_grading_periods_option.description: optional: Indicates whether the course the enrollment belongs to has the Display Totals for 'All Grading Periods' feature enabled. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_grading_period_title.description: optional: The name of the currently active grading period, if one exists. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_grading_period_id.description: optional: The id of the currently active grading period, if one exists. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_override_grade.description: The user's override grade for the current grading period.

current_period_override_score.description: The user's override score for the current grading period.

current_period_unposted_current_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course for the current grading period, including muted/unposted assignments. Only included if user has permission to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_unposted_final_score.description: optional: The student's score in the course for the current grading period, including muted/unposted assignments and including ungraded assignments with a score of 0. Only included if user has permission to view this score, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_unposted_current_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of current_period_unposted_current_score, if available. Only included if user has permission to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

current_period_unposted_final_grade.description: optional: The letter grade equivalent of current_period_unposted_final_score, if available. Only included if user has permission to view this grade, typically teachers, TAs, and admins. If the course the enrollment belongs to does not have grading periods, or if no currently active grading period exists, the value will be null. (applies only to student enrollments, and only available in course endpoints)

id.description: The id of the content share for the current user

name.description: The name of the shared content

content_type.description: The type of content that was shared. Can be assignment, discussion_topic, page, quiz, module, or module_item.

created_at.description: The datetime the content was shared with this user.

updated_at.description: The datetime the content was updated.

user_id.description: The id of the user who sent or received the content share.

sender.description: The user who shared the content. This field is provided only to receivers; it is not populated in the sender's list of sent content shares.

receivers.description: An Array of users the content is shared with.  This field is provided only to senders; an empty array will be returned for the receiving users.

source_course.description: The course the content was originally shared from.

read_state.description: Whether the recipient has viewed the content share.

content_export.description: The content export record associated with this content share

id.description: The ID of the calendar event

title.description: The title of the calendar event

start_at.description: The start timestamp of the event

end_at.description: The end timestamp of the event

description.description: The HTML description of the event

location_name.description: The location name of the event

location_address.description: The address where the event is taking place

context_code.description: the context code of the calendar this event belongs to (course, group, user, or account)

effective_context_code.description: if specified, it indicates which calendar this event should be displayed on. for example, a section-level event would have the course's context code here, while the section's context code would be returned above)

context_name.description: the context name of the calendar this event belongs to (course, user or group)

all_context_codes.description: a comma-separated list of all calendar contexts this event is part of

workflow_state.description: Current state of the event ('active', 'locked' or 'deleted') 'locked' indicates that start_at/end_at cannot be changed (though the event could be deleted). Normally only reservations or time slots with reservations are locked (see the Appointment Groups API)

hidden.description: Whether this event should be displayed on the calendar. Only true for course-level events with section-level child events.

parent_event_id.description: Normally null. If this is a reservation (see the Appointment Groups API), the id will indicate the time slot it is for. If this is a section-level event, this will be the course-level parent event.

child_events_count.description: The number of child_events. See child_events (and parent_event_id)

child_events.description: Included by default, but may be excluded (see include[] option). If this is a time slot (see the Appointment Groups API) this will be a list of any reservations. If this is a course-level event, this will be a list of section-level events (if any)

url.description: URL for this calendar event (to update, delete, etc.)

html_url.description: URL for a user to view this event

all_day.description: Boolean indicating whether this is an all-day event (midnight to midnight)

created_at.description: When the calendar event was created

updated_at.description: When the calendar event was last updated

appointment_group_id.description: Various Appointment-Group-related fields.These fields are only pertinent to time slots (appointments) and reservations of those time slots. See the Appointment Groups API. The id of the appointment group

appointment_group_url.description: The API URL of the appointment group

own_reservation.description: If the event is a reservation, this a boolean indicating whether it is the current user's reservation, or someone else's

reserve_url.description: If the event is a time slot, the API URL for reserving it

reserved.description: If the event is a time slot, a boolean indicating whether the user has already made a reservation for it

participant_type.description: The type of participant to sign up for a slot: 'User' or 'Group'

participants_per_appointment.description: If the event is a time slot, this is the participant limit

available_slots.description: If the event is a time slot and it has a participant limit, an integer indicating how many slots are available

user.description: If the event is a user-level reservation, this will contain the user participant JSON (refer to the Users API).

group.description: If the event is a group-level reservation, this will contain the group participant JSON (refer to the Groups API).

important_dates.description: Boolean indicating whether this has important dates.

series_uuid.description: Identifies the recurring event series this event may belong to.

rrule.description: An iCalendar RRULE for defining how events in a recurring event series repeat.

series_head.description: Boolean indicating if is the first event in the series of recurring events.

series_natural_language.description: A natural language expression of how events occur in the series.

blackout_date.description: Boolean indicating whether this has blackout date.

id.description: A synthetic ID for the assignment

start_at.description: The due_at timestamp of the assignment

end_at.description: The due_at timestamp of the assignment

description.description: The HTML description of the assignment

context_code.description: the context code of the (course) calendar this assignment belongs to

workflow_state.description: Current state of the assignment ('published' or 'deleted')

url.description: URL for this assignment (note that updating/deleting should be done via the Assignments API)

html_url.description: URL for a user to view this assignment

all_day_date.description: The due date of this assignment

all_day.description: Boolean indicating whether this is an all-day event (e.g. assignment due at midnight)

created_at.description: When the assignment was created

updated_at.description: When the assignment was last updated

assignment.description: The full assignment JSON data (See the Assignments API)

assignment_overrides.description: The list of AssignmentOverrides that apply to this event (See the Assignments API). This information is useful for determining which students or sections this assignment-due event applies to.

important_dates.description: Boolean indicating whether this has important dates.

rrule.description: An iCalendar RRULE for defining how events in a recurring event series repeat.

series_head.description: Trueif this is the first event in the series of recurring events.

series_natural_language.description: A natural language expression of how events occur in the series.

supplied_batches.description: Which files were included in the SIS import

counts.description: The number of rows processed for each type of import

created.description: This is the number of items that were created.

concluded.description: This is the number of items that marked as completed. This only applies to courses and enrollments.

deactivated.description: This is the number of Enrollments that were marked as 'inactive'. This only applies to enrollments.

restored.description: This is the number of items that were set to an active state from a completed, inactive, or deleted state.

deleted.description: This is the number of items that were deleted.

total_state_changes.description: This is the total number of items that were changed in the sis import. There are a few caveats that can cause this number to not add up to the individual counts. There are some state changes that happen that have no impact to the object. An example would be changing a course from 'created' to 'claimed'. Both of these would be considered an active course, but would increment this counter. In this example the course would not increment the created or restored counters for course statistic.

Account.description: This contains that statistics for accounts.

EnrollmentTerm.description: This contains that statistics for terms.

CommunicationChannel.description: This contains that statistics for communication channels. This is an indirect effect from creating or deleting a user.

AbstractCourse.description: This contains that statistics for abstract courses.

Course.description: This contains that statistics for courses.

CourseSection.description: This contains that statistics for course sections.

Enrollment.description: This contains that statistics for enrollments.

GroupCategory.description: This contains that statistics for group categories.

Group.description: This contains that statistics for groups.

GroupMembership.description: This contains that statistics for group memberships. This can be a direct impact from the import or indirect from an enrollment being deleted.

Pseudonym.description: This contains that statistics for pseudonyms. Pseudonyms are logins for users, and are the object that ties an enrollment to a user. This would be impacted from the user importer.

UserObserver.description: This contains that statistics for user observers.

AccountUser.description: This contains that statistics for account users.

batch_courses_deleted.description: the number of courses that were removed because they were not included in the batch for batch_mode imports. Only included if courses were deleted

batch_sections_deleted.description: the number of sections that were removed because they were not included in the batch for batch_mode imports. Only included if sections were deleted

batch_enrollments_deleted.description: the number of enrollments that were removed because they were not included in the batch for batch_mode imports. Only included if enrollments were deleted

id.description: The unique identifier for the SIS import.

created_at.description: The date the SIS import was created.

ended_at.description: The date the SIS import finished. Returns null if not finished.

updated_at.description: The date the SIS import was last updated.

workflow_state.description:
The current state of the SIS import.
 - 'initializing': The SIS import is being created, if this gets stuck in initializing, it will not import and will continue on to next import.
 - 'created': The SIS import has been created.
 - 'importing': The SIS import is currently processing.
 - 'cleanup_batch': The SIS import is currently cleaning up courses, sections, and enrollments not included in the batch for batch_mode imports.
 - 'imported': The SIS import has completed successfully.
 - 'imported_with_messages': The SIS import completed with errors or warnings.
 - 'aborted': The SIS import was aborted.
 - 'failed_with_messages': The SIS import failed with errors.
 - 'failed': The SIS import failed.
 - 'restoring': The SIS import is restoring states of imported items.
 - 'partially_restored': The SIS import is restored some of the states of imported items. This is generally due to passing a param like undelete only.
 - 'restored': The SIS import is restored all of the states of imported items.

progress.description: The progress of the SIS import. The progress will reset when using batch_mode and have a different progress for the cleanup stage

errors_attachment.description: The errors_attachment api object of the SIS import. Only available if there are errors or warning and import has completed.

user.description: The user that initiated the sis_batch. See the Users API for details.

processing_warnings.description: Only imports that are complete will get this data. An array of CSV_file/warning_message pairs.
example: user John Doe has already claimed john_doe's requested login information, skipping
Error while importing CSV. Please contact support.

batch_mode.description: Whether the import was run in batch mode.

batch_mode_term_id.description: The term the batch was limited to.

multi_term_batch_mode.description: Enables batch mode against all terms in term file. Requires change_threshold to be set.

skip_deletes.description: When set the import will skip any deletes.

add_sis_stickiness.description: Whether stickiness was added to the batch changes.

diffing_threshold_exceeded.description: Whether a diffing job failed because the threshold limit got exceeded.

diffing_data_set_identifier.description: The identifier of the data set that this SIS batch diffs against

diffing_remaster.description: Whether diffing remaster data was enabled.

diffed_against_import_id.description: The ID of the SIS Import that this import was diffed against

csv_attachments.description: An array of CSV files for processing

id.description: Valid for all providers.

log_in_url.description: Valid for SAML and CAS providers.

auth_base.description: Valid for LDAP and CAS providers.

jit_provisioning.description: Just In Time provisioning. Valid for all providers except Canvas (which has the similar in concept self_registration setting).

mfa_required.description: If multi-factor authentication is required when logging in with this authentication provider. The account must not have MFA disabled.

SSOSettings.description: Settings that are applicable across an account's authentication configuration, even if there are multiple individual providers

login_handle_name.description: The label used for unique login identifiers.

change_password_url.description: The url to redirect users to for password resets. Leave blank for default Canvas behavior

auth_discovery_url.description: If a discovery url is set, canvas will forward all users to that URL when they need to be authenticated. That page will need to then help the user figure out where they need to go to log in. If no discovery url is configured, the first configuration will be used to attempt to authenticate the user.

unknown_user_url.description: If an unknown user url is set, Canvas will forward to that url when a service authenticates a user, but that user does not exist in Canvas. The default behavior is to present an error.

FederatedAttributesConfig.description: A mapping of Canvas attribute names to attribute names that a provider may send, in order to update the value of these attributes when a user logs in. The values can be a FederatedAttributeConfig, or a raw string corresponding to the "attribute" property of a FederatedAttributeConfig. In responses, full FederatedAttributeConfig objects are returned if JIT provisioning is enabled, otherwise just the attribute names are returned.

admin_roles.description: A comma separated list of role names to grant to the user. Note that these only apply at the root account level, and not sub-accounts. If the attribute is not marked for provisioning only, the user will also be removed from any other roles they currently hold that are not still specified by the IdP.

display_name.description: The full display name of the user

given_name.description: The first, or given, name of the user

integration_id.description: The secondary unique identifier for SIS purposes

name.description: The full name of the user

sortable_name.description: The full name of the user for sorting purposes

surname.description: The surname, or last name, of the user

FederatedAttributeConfig.description: A single attribute name to be federated when a user logs in

attribute.description: The name of the attribute as it will be sent from the authentication provider

provisioning_only.description: If the attribute should be applied only when provisioning a new user, rather than all logins

autoconfirm.description: (only for email) If the email address is trusted and should be automatically confirmed

assignment.description: ID of the assignment associated with the event

course.description: ID of the course associated with the event. will match the context_id in the associated assignment if the context type for the assignment is a course

student.description: ID of the student associated with the event. will match the user_id in the associated submission.

grader.description: ID of the grader associated with the event. will match the grader_id in the associated submission.

page_view.description: ID of the page view during the event if it exists.

id.description: ID of the event.

created_at.description: timestamp of the event

excused_after.description: Boolean indicating whether the submission was excused after the change.

excused_before.description: Boolean indicating whether the submission was excused before the change.

graded_anonymously.description: Boolean indicating whether the student name was visible when the grade was given. Could be null if the grade change record was created before this feature existed.

version_number.description: Version Number of the grade change submission.

request_id.description: The unique request id of the request during the grade change.

id.description: the ID of the quiz report

report_type.description: which type of report this is possible values: 'student_analysis', 'item_analysis'

readable_type.description: a human-readable (and localized) version of the report_type

includes_all_versions.description: boolean indicating whether the report represents all submissions or only the most recent ones for each student

anonymous.description: boolean indicating whether the report is for an anonymous survey. if true, no student names will be included in the csv

generatable.description: boolean indicating whether the report can be generated, which is true unless the quiz is a survey one

created_at.description: when the report was created

updated_at.description: when the report was last updated

url.description: the API endpoint for this report

file.description: if the report has finished generating, a File object that represents it. refer to the Files API for more information about the format

progress_url.description: if the report has not yet finished generating, a URL where information about its progress can be retrieved. refer to the Progress API for more information (Note: not available in JSON-API format)

progress.description: if the report is being generated, a Progress object that represents the operation. Refer to the Progress API for more information about the format. (Note: available only in JSON-API format)

id.description: The ID of this topic.

message.description: The HTML content of the message body.

html_url.description: The URL to the discussion topic in canvas.

posted_at.description: The datetime the topic was posted. If it is null it hasn't been posted yet. (see delayed_post_at)

last_reply_at.description: The datetime for when the last reply was in the topic.

require_initial_post.description: If true then a user may not respond to other replies until that user has made an initial reply. Defaults to false.

user_can_see_posts.description: Whether or not posts in this topic are visible to the user.

discussion_subentry_count.description: The count of entries in the topic.

read_state.description: The read_state of the topic for the current user, 'read' or 'unread'.

unread_count.description: The count of unread entries of this topic for the current user.

subscribed.description: Whether or not the current user is subscribed to this topic.

subscription_hold.description: (Optional) Why the user cannot subscribe to this topic. Only one reason will be returned even if multiple apply. Can be one of: 'initial_post_required': The user must post a reply first; 'not_in_group_set': The user is not in the group set for this graded group discussion; 'not_in_group': The user is not in this topic's group; 'topic_is_announcement': This topic is an announcement

assignment_id.description: The unique identifier of the assignment if the topic is for grading, otherwise null.

delayed_post_at.description: The datetime to publish the topic (if not right away).

published.description: Whether this discussion topic is published (true) or draft state (false)

lock_at.description: The datetime to lock the topic (if ever).

locked.description: Whether or not the discussion is 'closed for comments'.

pinned.description: Whether or not the discussion has been 'pinned' by an instructor

locked_for_user.description: Whether or not this is locked for the user.

lock_info.description: (Optional) Information for the user about the lock. Present when locked_for_user is true.

lock_explanation.description: (Optional) An explanation of why this is locked for the user. Present when locked_for_user is true.
lock_explanation.example: This discussion is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

user_name.description: The username of the topic creator.

topic_children.description: DEPRECATED An array of topic_ids for the group discussions the user is a part of.

group_topic_children.description: An array of group discussions the user is a part of. Fields include: id, group_id

root_topic_id.description: If the topic is for grading and a group assignment this will point to the original topic in the course.

podcast_url.description: If the topic is a podcast topic this is the feed url for the current user.

discussion_type.description: The type of discussion. Values are 'side_comment' or 'not_threaded', for discussions that only allow one level of nested comments, and 'threaded' for fully threaded discussions.

group_category_id.description: The unique identifier of the group category if the topic is a group discussion, otherwise null.

permissions.description: The current user's permissions on this topic.

allow_rating.description: Whether or not users can rate entries in this topic.

only_graders_can_rate.description: Whether or not grade permissions are required to rate entries.

sort_by_rating.description: DEPRECATED, Whether or not entries should be sorted by rating.

sort_order.description: How entries should be sorted by default.

sort_order_locked.description: Can users decide their preferred sort order.

expand.description: Threaded replies should be expanded by default.

expand_locked.description: Can users decide their preferred thread expand setting.

enabled.description: Whether the role has the permission

locked.description: Whether the permission is locked by this role

applies_to_self.description: Whether the permission applies to the account this role is in. Only present if enabled is true

applies_to_descendants.description: Whether the permission cascades down to sub accounts of the account this role is in. Only present if enabled is true

readonly.description: Whether the permission can be modified in this role (i.e. whether the permission is locked by an upstream role).

explicit.description: Whether the value of enabled is specified explicitly by this role, or inherited from an upstream role.

prior_default.description: The value that would have been inherited from upstream if the role had not explicitly set a value. Only present if explicit is true.

id.description: The id of the role

role.description: The label of the role. (Deprecated alias for 'label')

base_role_type.description: The role type that is being used as a base for this role. For account-level roles, this is 'AccountMembership'. For course-level roles, it is an enrollment type.

is_account_role.description: Whether this role applies to account memberships (i.e., not linked to an enrollment in a course).

account.description: JSON representation of the account the role is defined in.

default_group_storage_quota_mb.description: The storage quota for a group in the account in megabytes, if not otherwise specified

default_time_zone.description: The default time zone of the account. Allowed time zones are {http://www.iana.org/time-zones IANA time zones} or friendlier {http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html Ruby on Rails time zones}.

sis_account_id.description: The account's identifier in the Student Information System. Only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

integration_id.description: The account's identifier in the Student Information System. Only included if the user has permission to view SIS information.

sis_import_id.description: The id of the SIS import if created through SIS. Only included if the user has permission to manage SIS information.

course_count.description: The number of courses directly under the account (available via include)

sub_account_count.description: The number of sub-accounts directly under the account (available via include)

lti_guid.description: The account's identifier that is sent as context_id in LTI launches.

id.description: The fully qualified URL for showing the Result

userId.description: The lti_user_id or the Canvas user_id

resultScore.description: The score of the result as defined by Canvas, scaled to the resultMaximum

resultMaximum.description: Maximum possible score for this result; 1 is the default value and will be assumed if not specified otherwise. Minimum value of 0 required.

comment.description: Comment visible to the student about the result.

scoreOf.description: URL of the line item this belongs to

ResultLinks.description: Unique identifiers of objects associated with a result

created_at.description: When this was created

updated_at.description: When this was last updated

id.description: The ID of the QuizQuestion this answer is for.

answer.description: The provided answer (if any) for this question. The format of this parameter depends on the type of the question, see the Appendix for more information.

answers.description: The possible answers for this question when those possible answers are necessary.  The presence of this parameter is dependent on permissions.

id.description: the ID of the learning object (not present for checkpoints)

due_at.description: the due date for the learning object. returns null if not present or applicable. never applicable for ungraded discussions, pages, and files

required_replies_due_at.description: the reply_to_entry sub_assignment due_date. returns null if not present

unlock_at.description: the unlock date (learning object is unlocked after this date). returns null if not present

graded.description: whether the learning object is graded (and thus has a due date)

blueprint_date_locks.description: [exclusive to blueprint child content only] list of lock types

visible_to_everyone.description: whether the learning object is visible to everyone

checkpoints.description: list of Checkpoint objects, only present if a learning object has subAssignments

tag.description: the tag identifying the type of checkpoint (only present for checkpoints)

Lti::LaunchDefinition.description: A bare-bones representation of an LTI tool used by Canvas to launch the tool

definition_type.description: The type of the launch definition. Always 'ContextExternalTool'

definition_id.description: The Canvas ID of the tool

Lti::PlacementLaunchDefinition.description: A bare-bones LTI configuration for a specific placement

url.description: The launch URL for this placement

title.description: The title of the tool for this placement

id.description: The Canvas ID of the binding

account_id.description: The global Canvas ID of the account in the binding

developer_key_id.description: The global Canvas ID of the developer key in the binding

workflow_state.description: The workflow state of the binding. Will be one of 'on', 'off', or 'allow.'

account_owns_binding.description: True if the requested context owns the binding

NamesAndRoleContext.description: An abbreviated representation of an LTI Context

id.description: LTI Context unique identifier

label.description: LTI Context short name or code

NamesAndRoleMessage.description: Additional attributes which would appear in the LTI launch message were this member to click the specified resource link (`rlid` query parameter)

https://purl.imsglobal.org/spec/lti/clai.description: The type of LTI message being described. Always set to 'LtiResourceLinkRequest'
Expanded LTI custom parameters that pertain to the member (as opposed to the Context)

NamesAndRoleMembership.description: A member of a LTI Context in one or more roles

name.description: Member's full name. Only included if tool privacy level is `public` or `name_only`.

picture.description: URL to the member's avatar. Only included if tool privacy level is `public`.

given_name.description: Member's 'first' name. Only included if tool privacy level is `public` or `name_only`.

family_name.description: Member's 'last' name. Only included if tool privacy level is `public` or `name_only`.

email.description: Member's email address. Only included if tool privacy level is `public` or `email_only`.

lis_person_sourcedid.description: Member's primary SIS identifier. Only included if tool privacy level is `public` or `name_only`.

user_id.description: Member's unique LTI identifier.

roles.description: Member's roles in the current Context, expressed as LTI/LIS URNs.

message.description: Only present when the request specifies a `rlid` query parameter. Contains additional attributes which would appear in the LTI launch message were this member to click the link referenced by the `rlid` query parameter

id.description: Invocation URL

context.description: The LTI Context containing the memberships

message.description: The message to be sent in the notification.
message.example: This is a test of the notification system.

start_at.description: When to send out the notification.

icon.description: The icon to display with the message.  Defaults to warning.

roles.description: (Deprecated) The roles to send the notification to.  If roles is not passed it defaults to all roles

role_ids.description: The roles to send the notification to.  If roles is not passed it defaults to all roles

author.description: The author of the notification. Available only to admins using include_all.

resource_type_code.description: the resource type code of the resource handler to use to display originality reports

resource_url.description: a URL that may be used to override the launch URL inferred by the specified resource_type_code. If used a 'resource_type_code' must also be specified.

id.description: The id of the OriginalityReport

file_id.description: The id of the file receiving the originality score

originality_score.description: A number between 0 and 100 representing the originality score

originality_report_file_id.description: The ID of the file within Canvas containing the originality report document (if provided)

originality_report_url.description: A non-LTI launch URL where the originality score of the file may be found.

tool_setting.description: A ToolSetting object containing optional 'resource_type_code' and 'resource_url'

error_report.description: A message describing the error. If set, the workflow_state will become 'error.'

submission_time.description: The submitted_at date time of the submission.

root_account_id.description: The id of the root Account associated with the OriginalityReport

provisional_grade_id.description: The identifier for the provisional grade

grade_matches_current_submission.description: Whether the grade was applied to the most current submission (false if the student resubmitted after grading)

final.description: Whether this is the 'final' provisional grade created by the moderator

speedgrader_url.description: A link to view this provisional grade in SpeedGrader

url.description: the unique locator for the page

created_at.description: the creation date for the page

updated_at.description: the date the page was last updated

hide_from_students.description: (DEPRECATED) whether this page is hidden from students (note: this is always reflected as the inverse of the published value)

editing_roles.description: roles allowed to edit the page; comma-separated list comprising a combination of 'teachers', 'students', 'members', and/or 'public' if not supplied, course defaults are used

last_edited_by.description: the User who last edited the page (this may not be present if the page was imported from another system)

body.description: the page content, in HTML (present when requesting a single page; optionally included when listing pages)

published.description: whether the page is published (true) or draft state (false).

publish_at.description: scheduled publication date for this page

front_page.description: whether this page is the front page for the wiki

locked_for_user.description: Whether or not this is locked for the user.

lock_info.description: (Optional) Information for the user about the lock. Present when locked_for_user is true.

lock_explanation.description: (Optional) An explanation of why this is locked for the user. Present when locked_for_user is true.
lock_explanation.example: This page is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

editor.description: The editor used to create and edit this page. May be one of 'rce' or 'block_editor'.

block_editor_attributes.description: The block editor attributes for this page. (optionally included, and only if this is a block editor created page)

revision_id.description: an identifier for this revision of the page

updated_at.description: the time when this revision was saved

latest.description: whether this is the latest revision or not

edited_by.description: the User who saved this revision, if applicable (this may not be present if the page was imported from another system)

url.description: the following fields are not included in the index action and may be omitted from the show action via summary=1 the historic url of the page

QuizSubmissionEvent.description: An event passed from the Quiz Submission take page

created_at.description: a timestamp record of creation time

event_type.description: the type of event being sent

event_data.description: custom contextual data for the specific event type

notification.description: The notification this preference belongs to

frequency.description: How often to send notifications to this communication channel for the given notification. Possible values are 'immediately', 'daily', 'weekly', and 'never'

due_at.description: The due date for the assignment. If a user id is supplied and an assignment override is in place this field will reflect the due date as it applies to the user.

visibility_level.description: Changes who can access the file. Valid options are 'inherit' (the default), 'course', 'institution', and 'public'. Only valid in course endpoints.

media_entry_id.description: identifier for file in third-party transcoding service

lock_explanation.example: This assignment is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

preview_url.description: optional: url to the document preview. This url is specific to the user making the api call. Only included in submission endpoints.

id.description: the unique identifier for the conversation.

workflow_state.description: The current state of the conversation (read, unread or archived).

last_message.description: A <=100 character preview from the most recent message.

start_at.description: the date and time at which the last message was sent.

message_count.description: the number of messages in the conversation.

subscribed.description: whether the current user is subscribed to the conversation.

properties.description: Additional conversation flags (last_author, attachments, media_objects). Each listed property means the flag is set to true (i.e. the current user is the most recent author, there are attachments, or there are media objects)

audience.description: Array of user ids who are involved in the conversation, ordered by participation level, then alphabetical. Excludes current user, unless this is a monologue.

audience_contexts.description: Most relevant shared contexts (courses and groups) between current user and other participants. If there is only one participant, it will also include that user's enrollment(s)/ membership type(s) in each course/group.

avatar_url.description: URL to appropriate icon for this conversation (custom, individual or group avatar, depending on audience).

participants.description: Array of users participating in the conversation. Includes current user.

visible.description: indicates whether the conversation is visible under the current scope and filter. This attribute is always true in the index API response, and is primarily useful in create/update responses so that you can know if the record should be displayed in the UI. The default scope is assumed, unless a scope or filter is passed to the create/update API call.

context_name.description: Name of the course or group in which the conversation is occurring.

id.description: The user ID for the participant.

name.description: A short name the user has selected, for use in conversations or other less formal places through the site.

full_name.description: The full name of the user.

avatar_url.description: If requested, this field will be included and contain a url to retrieve the user's avatar.

SearchResult.description: Reference to an object that matches a smart search

content_id.description: The ID of the matching object.

content_type.description: The type of the matching object.

title.description: The title of the matching object.

body.description: The body of the matching object.
body.example: Nicolaus Copernicus was a Renaissance-era mathematician and astronomer who...

html_url.description: The Canvas URL of the matching object.

distance.description: The distance between the search query and the result. Smaller numbers indicate closer matches.

title.description: The title of the grading period set.

weighted.description: If true, the grading periods in the set are weighted.

display_totals_for_all_grading_periods.description: If true, the totals for all grading periods in the set are displayed.

id.description: The ID of the communication channel.

address.description: The address, or path, of the communication channel.

type.description: The type of communcation channel being described. Possible values are: 'email', 'push', 'sms'. This field determines the type of value seen in 'address'.

position.description: The position of this communication channel relative to the user's other channels when they are ordered.

user_id.description: The ID of the user that owns this communication channel.

bounce_count.description: The number of bounces the channel has experienced. This is reset if the channel sends successfully.

last_bounce_at.description: The time the last bounce occurred.

workflow_state.description: The current state of the communication channel. Possible values are: 'unconfirmed' or 'active'.

for_submissions.description: If true, indicates this is a read-only folder containing files submitted to assignments

UsageRights.description: Describes the copyright and license information for a File

use_justification.description: Justification for using the file in a Canvas course. Valid values are 'own_copyright', 'public_domain', 'used_by_permission', 'fair_use', 'creative_commons'

file_ids.description: List of ids of files that were updated

id.description: a short string identifying the license

name.description: the name of the license

url.description: a link to the license text

id.description: the user_id of the user who graded the contained submissions

name.description: the name of the user who graded the contained submissions

assignments.description: the assignment groups for all submissions in this response that were graded by this user.  The details are not nested inside here, but the fact that an assignment is present here means that the grader did grade submissions for this assignment on the contextual date. You can use the id of a grader and of an assignment to make another API call to find all submissions for a grader/assignment combination on a given date.

date.description: the date represented by this entry

graders.description: an array of the graders who were responsible for the submissions in this response. the submissions are grouped according to the person who graded them and the assignment they were submitted for.

SubmissionVersion.description: A SubmissionVersion object contains all the fields that a Submission object does, plus additional fields prefixed with current_* new_* and previous_* described below.

assignment_id.description: the id of the assignment this submissions is for

assignment_name.description: the name of the assignment this submission is for

body.description: the body text of the submission

current_grade.description: the most up to date grade for the current version of this submission

current_graded_at.description: the latest time stamp for the grading of this submission

current_grader.description: the name of the most recent grader for this submission

grade_matches_current_submission.description: boolean indicating whether the grade is equal to the current submission grade

graded_at.description: time stamp for the grading of this version of the submission

grader.description: the name of the user who graded this version of the submission

grader_id.description: the user id of the user who graded this version of the submission

id.description: the id of the submission of which this is a version

new_grade.description: the updated grade provided in this version of the submission

new_graded_at.description: the timestamp for the grading of this version of the submission (alias for graded_at)

previous_grade.description: the grade for the submission version immediately preceding this one

previous_graded_at.description: the timestamp for the grading of the submission version immediately preceding this one

previous_grader.description: the name of the grader who graded the version of this submission immediately preceding this one

score.description: the score for this version of the submission

user_name.description: the name of the student who created this submission

url.description: the url of the submission, if there is one

workflow_state.description: the state of the submission at this version

versions.description: an array of all the versions of this submission

A flag indicating whether the ePortfolio has been

      'marked_as_safe', 'marked_as_spam', or null

id.description: The database ID of the ePortfolio

free_form_criterion_comments.description: whether or not free-form comments are used

data.description: An array with all of this Rubric's grading Criteria

id.description: the ID of the account associated with this calendar
