code.description: The actual code to be sent to other APIs

workflow_state.description: The current status of the code

id.description: the ID of the quiz

html_url.description: the HTTP/HTTPS URL to the quiz

mobile_url.description: a url suitable for loading the quiz in a mobile webview.  it will persiste the headless session and, for quizzes in public courses, will force the user to login

preview_url.description: A url that can be visited in the browser with a POST request to preview a quiz as the teacher. Only present when the user may grade

description.example: This is a quiz on Act 3 of Hamlet

assignment_group_id.description: the ID of the quiz's assignment group:

hide_results.description: let students see their quiz responses? possible values: null, 'always', 'until_after_last_attempt'

show_correct_answers.description: show which answers were correct when results are shown? only valid if hide_results=null

show_correct_answers_last_attempt.description: restrict the show_correct_answers option above to apply only to the last submitted attempt of a quiz that allows multiple attempts. only valid if show_correct_answers=true and allowed_attempts > 1

show_correct_answers_at.description: when should the correct answers be visible by students? only valid if show_correct_answers=true

hide_correct_answers_at.description: prevent the students from seeing correct answers after the specified date has passed. only valid if show_correct_answers=true

one_time_results.description: prevent the students from seeing their results more than once (right after they submit the quiz)

scoring_policy.description: which quiz score to keep (only if allowed_attempts != 1) possible values: 'keep_highest', 'keep_latest'

allowed_attempts.description: how many times a student can take the quiz -1 = unlimited attempts

one_question_at_a_time.description: show one question at a time?

question_count.description: the number of questions in the quiz

points_possible.description: The total point value given to the quiz

cant_go_back.description: lock questions after answering? only valid if one_question_at_a_time=true

access_code.description: access code to restrict quiz access

ip_filter.description: IP address or range that quiz access is limited to

published.description: whether the quiz has a published or unpublished draft state.

unpublishable.description: Whether the assignment's 'published' state can be changed to false. Will be false if there are student submissions for the quiz.

locked_for_user.description: Whether or not this is locked for the user.

lock_info.description: (Optional) Information for the user about the lock. Present when locked_for_user is true.

lock_explanation.description: (Optional) An explanation of why this is locked for the user. Present when locked_for_user is true.
lock_explanation.example: This quiz is locked until September 1 at 12:00am

speedgrader_url.description: Link to SpeedGrader for this quiz. Will not be present if quiz is unpublished

quiz_extensions_url.description: Link to endpoint to send extensions for this quiz.

permissions.description: Permissions the user has for the quiz

all_dates.description: list of due dates for the quiz

version_number.description: Current version number of the quiz

question_types.description: List of question types in the quiz

anonymous_submissions.description: Whether survey submissions will be kept anonymous (only applicable to 'graded_survey', 'survey' quiz types)

QuizPermissions.description: Permissions the user has for the quiz

read.description: whether the user can view the quiz

submit.description: whether the user may submit a submission for the quiz

create.description: whether the user may create a new quiz

manage.description: whether the user may edit, update, or delete the quiz

read_statistics.description: whether the user may view quiz statistics for this quiz

review_grades.description: whether the user may review grades for all quiz submissions for this quiz

update.description: whether the user may update the quiz

id.description: the ID of the quiz

assignment_group_id.description: the ID of the quiz's assignment group

points_possible.description: The total point value given to the quiz

published.description: whether the quiz has a published or unpublished draft state

grading_type.description: the type of grading the assignment receives ('pass_fail', 'percent', 'letter_grade', 'gpa_scale', or 'points')

calculator_type.description: type of calculator the user will have access to during the quiz ('none', basic' or 'scientific')

filter_ip_address.description: whether access to the quiz should be restricted to the IP address ranges described in 'filters'

filters.description: IP address ranges from which users can take the quiz, if 'filter_ip_address' is true

one_at_a_time_type.description: whether questions should be shown all at once ('none') or one-at-a-time ('question')

allow_backtracking.description: whether to allow user to return to previous questions when 'one_at_a_time_type' is set to 'question'

shuffle_answers.description: whether answers should be shuffled during quiz

shuffle_questions.description: whether questions should be shuffled during quiz

require_student_access_code.description: whether to require an access code to take the quiz (set as 'student_access_code')

student_access_code.description: access code that is required to take the quiz if 'require_student_access_code' is true

has_time_limit.description: whether the quiz has a time limit (set as 'session_time_limit_in_seconds')

session_time_limit_in_seconds.description: time limit during the quiz (in seconds)

multiple_attempts.description: settings to configure multiple quiz attempts (see MultipleAttemptsSettings)

result_view_settings.description: settings to restrict student result view (see ResultViewSettings)

attempt_limit.description: whether to limit the number of attempts if 'multiple_attempts_enabled' is true. Unlimited attempts if false.

max_attempts.description: number of attempts to allow if 'multiple_attempts_enabled' and 'attempt_limit' are true

score_to_keep.description: specifies which score to keep after attempts ('average', 'first', 'highest', or 'latest')

cooling_period.description: whether to enforce a waiting period after an attempt (set as 'cooling_period_seconds')

cooling_period_seconds.description: required waiting period (in seconds) between attempts. Enforced if 'cooling_period' is true.

result_view_restricted.description: whether to restrict the student result view

display_points_awarded.description: whether to show points awarded (overall and per question), if 'result_view_restricted' is true

display_points_possible.description: whether to show points possible (overall and per question), if 'result_view_restricted' is true

display_items.description: whether to show questions in the result view, if 'result_view_restricted' is true

display_item_response.description: whether to show student's responses in the result view, if 'display_items' is true

display_item_response_qualifier.description: whether student responses should be shown for all attempts ('always'), only once after each attempt ('once_per_attempt'), only after their last attempt ('after_last_attempt'), or only once after their last attempt ('once_after_last_attempt'). if 'display_item_response' is true

show_item_responses_at.description: when student responses should be shown to them, if 'display_item_responses' is true

hide_item_responses_at.description: when student responses should be hidden from them, if 'display_item_responses' is true. must be later than 'show_item_responses_at'

display_item_response_correctness.description: whether to indicate whether the student's response is correct/incorrect, if 'display_item_response' is true

display_item_response_correctness_qualif.description: whether student response correctness should be shown for all attempts ('always') or only after their last attempt ('after_last_attempt'), if 'display_item_response_correctness' is true

show_item_response_correctness_at.description: when correctness of student responses should be shown to them, if 'display_item_response_correctness' is true

hide_item_response_correctness_at.description: when correctness of student responses should be hidden from them, if 'display_item_response_correctness' is true. must be later than 'show_item_response_correctness_at'

display_item_correct_answer.description: whether to show the correct answer for each question, if 'display_item_response_correctness' is true

display_item_feedback.description: whether to show feedback for each item, if 'display_items' is true

context_id.description: The ID of the object the Favorite refers to

context_type.description: The type of the object the Favorite refers to (currently, only 'Course' is supported)

id.description: Terms Of Service id

terms_type.description: The given type for the Terms of Service

passive.description: Boolean dictating if the user must accept Terms of Service

account_id.description: The id of the root account that owns the Terms of Service

content.description: Content of the Terms of Service
content.example: To be or not to be that is the question

self_registration_type.description: The type of self registration allowed

id.description: The ID of the help link

text.description: The name of the help link

subtext.description: The description of the help link
subtext.example: Questions are submitted to your instructor

url.description: The URL of the help link

type.description: The type of the help link

available_to.description: The roles that have access to this help link

custom_help_links.description: Help links defined by the account. Could include default help links.

default_help_links.description: Default help links provided when account has not set help links of their own.

example.subtext: Questions are submitted to your instructor
If Canvas misbehaves, tell us about it

id.description: the unique identifier for the course

name.description: the name for the course

id.description: the unique identifier for the export

created_at.description: the date and time this export was requested

attachment.description: attachment api object for the export ePub (not present until the export completes)

progress_url.description: The api endpoint for polling the current progress

user_id.description: The ID of the user who started the export

workflow_state.description: Current state of the ePub export: created exporting exported generating generated failed

id.description: The ID of the Assignment Group

global_id.description: The global ID of the Assignment Group

score.description: The score for the Assignment Group

possible.description: The total points possible for the Assignment Group

weight.description: The weight for the Assignment Group

grade.description: The grade for the Assignment Group

dropped.description: The dropped grades for the Assignment Group

id.description: The unique identifier for the grading period.

title.description: The title for the grading period.

start_date.description: The start date of the grading period.

end_date.description: The end date of the grading period.

close_date.description: Grades can only be changed before the close date of the grading period.

weight.description: A weight value that contributes to the overall weight of a grading period set which is used to calculate how much assignments in this period contribute to the total grade

is_closed.description: If true, the grading period's close_date has passed.

name.description: The name for an entry value within a GradingStandard that describes the range of the value

value.description: The value for the name of the entry within a GradingStandard. The entry represents the lower bound of the range for the entry. This range includes the value up to the next entry in the GradingStandard, or the maximum value for the scheme if there is no upper bound. The lowest value will have a lower bound range of 0.

calculated_value.description: The value that will be used to compare against a grade. For percentage based grading schemes, this is a number from 0 - 100 representing a percent. For point based grading schemes, this is the lower bound of points to achieve the grade.

title.description: the title of the grading standard

id.description: the id of the grading standard

context_type.description: the context this standard is associated with, either 'Account' or 'Course'

context_id.description: the id for the context either the Account or Course id

points_based.description: whether this is a points-based standard

scaling_factor.description: the factor by which to scale a score. 1 for percentage based schemss and the max value of points for points based schemes. This number cannot be changed for percentage based schemes.

grading_scheme.description: A list of GradingSchemeEntry that make up the Grading Standard as an array of values with the scheme name and value

token.description: The signed, encrypted, base64 encoded JWT

id.description: The ID of the custom gradebook column

teacher_notes.description: When true, this column's visibility will be toggled in the Gradebook when a user selects to show or hide notes

hidden.description: won't be displayed if hidden is true

read_only.description: won't be editable in the gradebook UI

ColumnDatum.description: ColumnDatum objects contain the entry for a column for each user.

id.description: The ID of the template.

course_id.description: The ID of the Course the template belongs to.

last_export_completed_at.description: Time when the last export was completed

associated_course_count.description: Number of associated courses for the template

id.description: The ID of the migration.

template_id.description: The ID of the template the migration belongs to. Only present when querying a blueprint course.

subscription_id.description: The ID of the associated course's blueprint subscription. Only present when querying a course associated with a blueprint.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who queued the migration.

workflow_state.description: Current state of the content migration: queued, exporting, imports_queued, completed, exports_failed, imports_failed

created_at.description: Time when the migration was queued

imports_queued_at.description: Time when the exports were completed and imports were queued

imports_completed_at.description: Time when the imports were completed

comment.description: User-specified comment describing changes made in this operation
comment.example: Fixed spelling in question 3 of midterm exam

BlueprintRestriction.description: A set of restrictions on editing for copied objects in associated courses

content.description: Restriction on main content (e.g. title, description).

points.description: Restriction on points possible for assignments and graded learning objects

due_dates.description: Restriction on due dates for assignments and graded learning objects

availability_dates.description: Restriction on availability dates for an object

ChangeRecord.description: Describes a learning object change propagated to associated courses from a blueprint course

asset_id.description: The ID of the learning object that was changed in the blueprint course.

asset_type.description: The type of the learning object that was changed in the blueprint course.  One of 'assignment', 'attachment', 'discussion_topic', 'external_tool', 'quiz', 'wiki_page', 'syllabus', or 'settings'.  For 'syllabus' or 'settings', the asset_id is the course id.

asset_name.description: The name of the learning object that was changed in the blueprint course.

change_type.description: The type of change; one of 'created', 'updated', 'deleted'

html_url.description: The URL of the changed object

locked.description: Whether the object is locked in the blueprint

exceptions.description: A list of ExceptionRecords for linked courses that did not receive this update.

ExceptionRecord.description: Lists associated courses that did not receive a change propagated from a blueprint

course_id.description: The ID of the associated course

conflicting_changes.description: A list of change classes in the associated course's copy of the item that prevented a blueprint change from being applied. One or more of ['content', 'points', 'due_dates', 'availability_dates'].

BlueprintSubscription.description: Associates a course with a blueprint

id.description: The ID of the blueprint course subscription

template_id.description: The ID of the blueprint template the associated course is subscribed to

ErrorReport.description: A collection of information around a specific notification of a problem

subject.description: The users problem summary, like an email subject line

comments.description: long form documentation of what was witnessed
comments.example: When I went to upload a .mov file to my files page, I got an error.  Retrying didn't help, other file types seem ok

user_perceived_severity.description: categorization of how bad the user thinks the problem is.  Should be one of [just_a_comment, not_urgent, workaround_possible, blocks_what_i_need_to_do, extreme_critical_emergency].

email.description: the email address of the reporting user

url.description: URL of the page on which the error was reported

context_asset_string.description: string describing the asset being interacted with at the time of error.  Formatted '[type]_[id]'

user_roles.description: comma seperated list of roles the reporting user holds.  Can be one [student], or many [teacher,admin]

id.description: The unique identifier for the poll choice.

poll_id.description: The id of the poll this poll choice belongs to.

is_correct.description: Specifies whether or not this poll choice is a 'correct' choice.

text.description: The text of the poll choice.

position.description: The order of the poll choice in relation to it's sibling poll choices.

SisAssignment.description: Assignments that have post_to_sis enabled with other objects for convenience

id.description: The unique identifier for the assignment.

course_id.description: The unique identifier for the course.

name.description: the name of the assignment

created_at.description: The time at which this assignment was originally created

due_at.description: the due date for the assignment. returns null if not present. NOTE: If this assignment has assignment overrides, this field will be the due date as it applies to the user requesting information from the API.

unlock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be unlocked.

lock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be locked.

points_possible.description: The maximum points possible for the assignment

submission_types.description: the types of submissions allowed for this assignment list containing one or more of the following: 'discussion_topic', 'online_quiz', 'on_paper', 'none', 'external_tool', 'online_text_entry', 'online_url', 'online_upload', 'media_recording', 'student_annotation'

integration_id.description: Third Party integration id for assignment

integration_data.description: (optional, Third Party integration data for assignment)

include_in_final_grade.description: If false, the assignment will be omitted from the student's final grade

assignment_group.description: Includes attributes of a assignment_group for convenience. For more details see Assignments API.

sections.description: Includes attributes of a section for convenience. For more details see Sections API.

user_overrides.description: Includes attributes of a user assignment overrides. For more details see Assignments API.

AssignmentGroupAttributes.description: Some of the attributes of an Assignment Group. See Assignments API for more details

id.description: the id of the Assignment Group

name.description: the name of the Assignment Group

group_weight.description: the weight of the Assignment Group

sis_source_id.description: the sis source id of the Assignment Group

integration_data.description: the integration data of the Assignment Group

SectionAttributes.description: Some of the attributes of a section. For more details see Sections API.

id.description: The unique identifier for the section.

name.description: The name of the section.

sis_id.description: The sis id of the section.

integration_id.description: Optional: The integration ID of the section.

origin_course.description: The course to which the section belongs or the course from which the section was cross-listed

xlist_course.description: Optional: Attributes of the xlist course. Only present when the section has been cross-listed. See Courses API for more details

override.description: Optional: Attributes of the assignment override that apply to the section. See Assignment API for more details

CourseAttributes.description: Attributes of a course object.  See Courses API for more details

id.description: The unique Canvas identifier for the origin course

name.description: The name of the origin course.

sis_id.description: The sis id of the origin_course.

integration_id.description: The integration ID of the origin_course.

SectionAssignmentOverrideAttributes.description: Attributes of an assignment override that apply to the section object.  See Assignments API for more details

override_title.description: The title for the assignment override

due_at.description: the due date for the assignment. returns null if not present. NOTE: If this assignment has assignment overrides, this field will be the due date as it applies to the user requesting information from the API.

unlock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be unlocked.

lock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be locked.

UserAssignmentOverrideAttributes.description: Attributes of assignment overrides that apply to users.  See Assignments API for more details

id.description: The unique Canvas identifier for the assignment override

title.description: The title of the assignment override.

due_at.description: The time at which this assignment is due

unlock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be unlocked.

lock_at.description: (Optional) Time at which this was/will be locked.

students.description: Includes attributes of a student for convenience. For more details see Users API.

StudentAttributes.description: Attributes of student.  See Users API for more details

user_id.description: The unique Canvas identifier for the user

sis_user_id.description: The SIS ID associated with the user.  This field is only included if the user came from a SIS import and has permissions to view SIS information.
